intro: Carex stricta f. polystachya, commonly known as the tussock sedge, is a variant of the common tussock sedge native to North America. It is a perennial plant characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist to wet habitats such as marshes, bogs, and along stream banks. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps stabilize soil and supports its growth in waterlogged environments. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
